edu.rit.gpu.example

Class PiGpu2

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rit.pj2.Task
      • edu.rit.gpu.example.PiGpu2

  • public class PiGpu2
extends Task
    Class PiGpu2 is a GPU parallel program that calculates an approximate value for π using a Monte Carlo technique. The program generates a number of random points in the unit square (0,0) to (1,1) and counts how many of them lie within a circle of radius 1 centered at the origin. The fraction of the points within the circle is approximately π/4. The program runs on a single node, using all the GPUs on the node.

    Usage: java pj2 edu.rit.gpu.example.PiGpu2 seed N
    seed = Random seed
    N = Number of random points
